intro: Hedysarum boreale f. album, commonly known as the white-flowered field vetch, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, and it is often found in the northern regions of its native range. Hedysarum boreale f. album is a perennial herb that produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
